meanings.definition: A term of endearment or affectionate nickname.
meanings.sent1: My grandma calls me 'toots' because she loves me.
meanings.sent2: The little girl hugged her teddy bear and said, 'Goodnight, toots.'
meanings.sent3: The puppy wagged its tail happily when its owner called it 'toots'.
meanings.sent4: The old man smiled and said, 'You're a real toots, you know that?'
meanings.sent5: She always greets her best friend with a warm 'Hey, toots!'

meanings.definition: A short, sharp sound made by a horn or whistle.
meanings.sent1: The toots of the train whistle echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent2: The referee blew a loud toots to signal the end of the game.
meanings.sent3: The toots of the car horn startled the pedestrians.
meanings.sent4: The toots of the whistle pierced through the noisy crowd.
meanings.sent5: The toots of the horn warned the drivers of the approaching train.

meanings.definition: To emit a short, sharp sound, as a horn or whistle.
meanings.sent1: The train toots loudly as it leaves the station.
meanings.sent2: The referee toots the whistle to start the match.
meanings.sent3: The little boy toots on his toy trumpet, trying to play a tune.
meanings.sent4: The bird toots a cheerful melody in the morning.
meanings.sent5: The car toots to alert the pedestrians crossing the street.
